example.eg: The chef gave a demonstration of the proper way to skin a chicken.
example.egtrans: 大厨演示了给鸡除皮的正确方法。

example.eg: Her short dress was not proper clothing for church.
example.egtrans: 她这身短裙子不宜在教堂穿着。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 适宜的，适合的，适当的, 合乎体统的，得体的

example.eg: The British nanny was very proper with the children.
example.egtrans: 英国保姆对待孩子们的态度中规中矩的。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 正统的, 中规中矩的

example.eg: A handle is not part of a door proper, but it is an essential extra.
example.egtrans: 把手并非门本身的一部分，但是一件重要的组成部分。

example.eg: We need around one hundred more staff, but will give you a proper figure tomorrow.
example.egtrans: 我们还需要大约100位员工，确切数字我明天给你。

example.eg: Potato chips and candy are not a proper dinner!
example.egtrans: 薯片和糖果可算不上真正的晚餐！

trans_examp.trans_cn: 真正的, 名副其实的

example.eg: My dad was proper angry when he found out what I'd done.
example.egtrans: 我爸发现我干的事后勃然大怒。

example.eg: Please use your proper legal name when filling out this form.
In English, common nouns usually begin with a lower-case letter and proper nouns with a capital.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 专有名词, 特有名词, 固有名词

example.eg: Fruit must be harvested at the proper time if it is to reach the consumer in peak condition.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 适当的时间, 最合适的时候
是…特有的, 为…的特色

example.eg: It's only right and proper that you apologize to her.
